--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "stixwix00" <stixwix@h...> wrote:
> I am wond=
ering if there is a 'standard' way to have a report of what
> testsuites/te=
st methods JUnit has run and the test results.
> I had a quick look at the =
Junitreport Ant task but ideally don't want
> to run the tests from Ant, an=
d anyway, its not obvious to me how to
> proceed with this approach.
> Othe=
rs speak of Maven but that may be overkill...

Have you considered running =
Junitreport directly from Java? I haven't
tried it myself, but I've run oth=
er Ant tasks outside Ant itself. You
would need to set "Anty" properties su=
ch as the Project appropriately,
but that shouldn't be too hard.

Alternati=
vely, rip out the guts of Junitreport (in
XMLResultAggregator.java, btw) an=
d use it directly. More work in the
short term, but easier to use in the lo=
nger term.

There may well be other alternatives, of course - but I've used=

Junitreport with great success. (I've modified the transforms involved
to =
cope with the idea of "ignored" tests, as we convert NUnit reports
to a JUn=
it XML format first.)

Jon
